cufy.io

Class Buffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cufy.io.Buffer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of data this buffer is holding

    public class Buffer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A buffer to store values and get them by a cursor. Type compat all managed by the trust of the user :).
    Since:
    9-Jan-2020
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int chunkSize
      The size of every expand on the data of this buffer.
      protected int cursor
      Indicates to the index were the next input/output operation will be applied to.
      protected T[] data
      The data that this buffer is carrying.
      protected int size
      Indicates to the size of the valid data on the data array of this.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer()
      Construct a new buffer with the default chunk size.
      Buffer(int initialSize, int chunkSize)
      Construct a new buffer with the specified initial size.

    • Field Detail

      • chunkSize

        protected final int chunkSize
        The size of every expand on the data of this buffer.

      • cursor

        protected int cursor
        Indicates to the index were the next input/output operation will be applied to.

      • data

        protected T[] data
        The data that this buffer is carrying.

      • size

        protected int size
        Indicates to the size of the valid data on the data array of this.

        Note: no decrementing allowed

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer()
        Construct a new buffer with the default chunk size.

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int initialSize,
              int chunkSize)
        Construct a new buffer with the specified initial size. And the specified chunk size.
        Parameters:
        initialSize - the initial size
        chunkSize - the size to be added on each expand request
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given chunkSize, initialSize is less than one. (As will for the initialSize)

    • Method Detail

      • duplicate

        public Buffer<T> duplicate(int off,
                           int chunkSize)
        Create a new buffer that contains the data of this buffer. (BUT cursor set to 0). Data trimmed from the offset specified.
        Parameters:
        off - the position to start copying from
        chunkSize - the chunk-size for the returned buffer
        Returns:
        a duplicate buffer of this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given 'off' is out of this buffer's bounds
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given 'chunkSize' is not greater than 0

      • getCursor

        public int getCursor()
        Returns the index that the cursor of this is pointing to.
        Returns:
        the index that the cursor of this is pointing to

      • setCursor

        public void setCursor(int index)
        Set the current cursor to be pointing to the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - to set the cursor to point to (if the index is greater than the size of this. The index will be set to the size of this)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given index is negative.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Get the number of values stored at this. Useful when dealing directly to the cursor.
        Returns:
        the number of values on this

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Return wither this buffer has more values to return.
        Returns:
        whether this buffer has more data to be read or not

      • read

        public T read()
        Read the value that the cursor of this buffer is pointing on. Then set the cursor to the next value. If the cursor pointing to a value that is out of this buffer's bounds. Or the cursor is pointing to a value that isn't set yet. Then null will be returned.
        Returns:
        the value pointed to by the cursor of this. Or null if pointing to a value out of bounds or pointing to a value not set yet.

      • read

        public int read(java.lang.Object[] buffer,
                int off,
                int len)
        Reads values into a portion of an array.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Destination buffer
        off - Offset at which to start storing values
        len - Maximum number of values to read
        Returns:
        The number of values read, or -1 if the end of the buffer has been reached
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if (off >= cbuf.length). Or (off + len >= cbuf.length). Or (off < 0). Or (len < 0)
        See Also:
        Reader.read(char[], int, int)

        public int read0(java.lang.Object buffer,
                 int off,
                 int len)
        Reads values into a portion of an array.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Destination buffer
        off - Offset at which to start storing values
        len - Maximum number of values to read
        Returns:
        The number of values read, or -1 if the end of the buffer has been reached
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if (off >= cbuf.length). Or (off + len >= cbuf.length). Or (off < 0). Or (len < 0)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given 'cbuf' is not an array

        Reader.read(char[], int, int)

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Get the number of remaining values in this. (depending on the cursor)
        Returns:
        the number of remaining values

      • skip

        public int skip(int ns)
        Increment the cursor by the given number. Or set the cursor to the size of this if the size reached by the incrementation.
        Parameters:
        ns - the number of values to be skipped
        Returns:
        the number of values actually skipped
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given 'ns' is less than zero

      • write

        public void write(T value)
        Add the given value to this on were the cursor of this buffer is on. Then increment the cursor of this by one.
        Parameters:
        value - to be set

      • write

        public void write(int[] buffer,
                  int off,
                  int len)
        Add the given values to this on were the cursor of this buffer is on. Then increment the cursor of this by the length of the given collection.
        Parameters:
        buffer - to read from
        off - the offset to start storing from
        len - the maximum number of values to store
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if (off >= cbuf.length). Or (off + len >= cbuf.length). Or (off < 0). Or (len < 0)

      • expand

        protected void expand(int length)
        Expand the data array of this buffer to a length greater than the given length.
        Parameters:
        length - the minimum length allowed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given length is less than zero
